answers.answer: Hello,It is true that wound healing is delayed in diabetics but if it is under control and appropriate precautions are taken, then it won’t cause much of a problem. Treatment options include removing with scissors, freezing (using liquid nitrogen), and burning (using medical electric cautery at the physician's office). You should consult a dermatologist to find out which treatment is the best one for your husband.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: My Husband is diabetic and currently taking glucophage for his diabetes which is being well controlled by myself at the moment. title: Diabetic with skin Tags
